verses.text: At that time the \sc Lord\sc* said unto me, Hew thee two tables of stone like unto the first, and come up unto me into the mount, and make thee an ark of wood.
And I will write on the tables the words that were in the first tables which thou brakest, and thou shalt put them in the ark.
And I made an ark of shittim wood, and hewed two tables of stone like unto the first, and went up into the mount, having the two tables in mine hand.

And he wrote on the tables, according to the first writing, the ten commandments, which the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto you in the mount out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly: and the \sc Lord\sc* gave them unto me.
And I turned myself and came down from the mount, and put the tables in the ark which I had made; and there they be, as the \sc Lord\sc* commanded me.

And the children of Israel took their journey from Beeroth of the children of Jaakan \add to\add* Mosera: there Aaron died, and there he was buried; and Eleazar his son ministered in the priest’s office in his stead.
From thence they journeyed \add unto\add* Gudgodah; and from Gudgodah to Jotbath, a land of rivers of waters.

At that time the \sc Lord\sc* separated the tribe of Levi, to bear the ark of the covenant of the \sc Lord\sc*, to stand before the \sc Lord\sc* to minister unto him, and to bless in his name, unto this day.
Wherefore Levi hath no part nor inheritance with his brethren; the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* his inheritance, according as the \sc Lord\sc* thy God promised him.
And I stayed in the mount, according to the first time, forty days and forty nights; and the \sc Lord\sc* hearkened unto me at that time also, \add and\add* the \sc Lord\sc* would not destroy thee.
And the \sc Lord\sc* said unto me, Arise, take thy journey before the people, that they may go in and possess the land, which I sware unto their fathers to give unto them.

And now, Israel, what doth the \sc Lord\sc* thy God require of thee, but to fear the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, to walk in all his ways, and to love him, and to serve the \sc Lord\sc* thy God with all thy heart and with all thy soul,
to keep the commandments of the \sc Lord\sc*, and his statutes, which I command thee \add this\add* day for thy good?
Behold, the heaven and the heaven of heavens \add is\add* the \sc Lord’s\sc* thy God, the earth \add also\add*, with all that therein \add is\add*.
Only the \sc Lord\sc* had a delight in thy fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, \add even\add* you above all people, as \add it is\add* this day.
Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart, and be no more stiffnecked.
For the \sc Lord\sc* your God \add is\add* God of gods, and Lord of lords, a great God, a mighty, and a terrible, which regardeth not persons, nor taketh reward:
he doth execute the judgment of the fatherless and widow, and loveth the stranger, in giving him food and raiment.
Love ye therefore the stranger: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
Thou shalt fear the \sc Lord\sc* thy God; him shalt thou serve, and to him shalt thou cleave, and swear by his name.
He \add is\add* thy praise, and he \add is\add* thy God, that hath done for thee these great and terrible \add things\add*, which thine eyes have seen.
Thy fathers went down into Egypt with threescore and ten persons; and now the \sc Lord\sc* thy God hath made thee as the stars of heaven for multitude.
